intro: Cousinia khorramabadensis var. khorramabadensis, commonly known as the Khorramabad cudweed, is a flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces yellow to white flowers that bloom in the summer months. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution.
